passages.text: \*GS Asia... 6 \*Bullet Points on Asia EM Local \* [The View from the Captain's Bar]
\*高盛亚洲……关于亚洲新兴市场本地的6个要点\* [来自船长酒吧的观点]

As I sit and gaze out over Victoria Harbour, its notable that there are number of idiosyncratic themes within Asia at play and for the first time in a while, almost every regional market has something more to discuss than just a broader beta to the USD or core rates. The dispersion of performance has thus been interesting and more akin to what global EM investors have become used to in other regions.

Starting with performance / flows .. regional performance has been mixed - reflective of the various stories at play. Proxied by the 5yr bond in each market, an index- weight FX unhedged GBI- EM Asia Sub- index returning circa 20bp - dragged entirely down by a - 2% return from India, the region underperforming CEEMEA (50bp) and LATAM (75bp). HY EM ownership has made for happier times in Mexico/Brasil/South Africa than in Asia last month - though Indonesia saw a sharp 250bp swing in total return in the last week of the month. For more on the fund- flows - see the latest note from GIR here.
Chart: GBI-EM Proxy Performance (Data as of EoD 31August2025)
1M Contribution Return (in pp%) to the GBI-EM index
Should your flavour be a bit more USD credit, as always – the two flagship pieces from the Asia Credit Sales desk (penned by Neel Dave) are worth your time.

- GS Asia Credit: Weekly RiskMovers https://marquee.gs.com/content/markets/en/2025/09/01/7e542fa4-a485-46c0-b1cb-6244a1be30fa.html- GS Asia Credit: Weekly Themes & RiskViews https://marquee.gs.com/content/markets/en/2025/08/31/e75b022e-ea4f-4322-a2e4-9f580332eed4.html
Moving back to local – the themes are multifold – I’ll attempt to flesh out some of these themes.

1. Questions over the longevity and depth of the China (equity) rally and the implications for fx/rates in light of the higher than beta shift lower last week in the USDCNY fix. On the equity side, the weekly note from Sean Navin (here) provides a great overview – with the conclusion being that we are still early in the innings for potential equity market return. On the FX side, Sun Lu’s note here from Thursday provides some context to the lower USDCNY fix that has dragged a bit more interest back into the short USDCNH trade. Indeed – this was followed up by GIR in the weekend’s FX Trader piece with it being described as a policy push’ rather than a ‘market pull’. 6mo CNH Forward points have risen \(\sim 100\) pips over the past 2 weeks, reducing the negative carry burden of a short USDCNH position – largely due to the lower US STIR environment. In local rates – the ‘wedge’ between the market’s pricing of 7d interbank rates and the PBOC 7d OMO rate that existed for a large portion of the past 2yrs (until end Q225) is no longer a market dynamic with this metric and the metric between where deposit taking institutions (DR) and the broader market (FR) narrowing. As per the chart on the left below, the system currently operates in the most significant liquidity surplus of the past 5yrs – equity and rates tell the same story. This piece from Andrew Tilton / Hui Shan goes over the changes in China’s liquidity conditions and is worth the read – in essence, China has eased considerably and the recent pivot towards being less dovish probably is justified given the liquidity injection and the compression of both credit (LGBs vs CGBs and FR vs OMO) spreads in the past 6-12mo. The

IRS / Bond curve has sufficiently steepened (6m6m vs 3y2y IRS sits at 22bp (12mo high) with 6m6m pricing in essence unchanged liquidity at 1.50% and 3y2y above 1.70% pricing in a decent amount – if not mild – upside growth.
Chart: Liquidity Injections / China Shop Rates

2. How do we approach Indian markets? Despite inflation being low, and real rates being high; rates negative impulses from recent growth data and expectations of a potentially larger fiscal burden from tariff protection continues to weigh on rates markets. Since the 50bp cut in June, the RBI have been a major hurdle to received rates trades with liquidity having been managed to trade within the middle of the 50bp wide corridor and around the 5.50% policy rate (chart below). A hike is unlikely to be more than a 5% probability event in the next 12mo, and the RBI have enough tools to soften any FX weakness led tightness of liquidity so the market still finds distributional value in trading received when fixed rates are \(>5.52 - 5.54\%\) in the sub 12mo part of the OIS curve on the basis that it has an option like

format. A mixture of higher tariff imposition, reduced RBI MMOs (which supported the 10yr point) and better growth in Q2 (in contrast to expectations) / market essentially expecting the headline/core cpi difference to normalize via an inflexion higher in headline towards the end of the year and into Jan- Mar, and the curve shape has notably steepened. Bonds have been the weak point and 5x10 IGBs has steepened from +20bp to +32bp and 10x30 IGBs sit around +70bp needing a catalyst to flatten despite outright yields being north of 7.30% and a level we think local insurance find value – the problem here is the preference in the fund flows for this cohort to allocate more to equity markets.

2. 我们应如何看待印度市场？尽管通胀水平较低、实际利率较高，但近期增长数据带来的利率负面影响，以及关税保护可能带来更大财政负担的预期，仍在持续压制利率市场。自6月降息50个基点以来，印度央行（RBI）一直是利率接收交易的主要障碍，其通过流动性管理，使利率交易维持在50个基点宽走廊的中间位置，并围绕5.50%的政策利率波动（如下图所示）。未来12个月内加息的可能性不超过5%，而且RBI拥有足够的工具来缓解因外汇疲软引发的流动性紧缩，因此市场在固定利率高于5.52-5.54%时，仍在OIS曲线12个月以内的部分找到接收交易的分布价值，理由是其具有类似期权的结构。更高的关税征收、RBI减少货币市场操作（此前支撑了10年期利率点位）、第二季度优于预期的经济增长，以及市场普遍预期年底至次年一季度期间，整体CPI与核心CPI的差距将通过整体CPI的拐点上行来收敛，这些因素共同推动了收益率曲线形态明显变陡。债券一直是薄弱环节，5x10年期IGB的陡峭度已从+20个基点上升至+32个基点，10x30年期IGB约为+70个基点，尽管整体收益率高于7.30%，且我们认为本地保险公司在这一水平上会发现价值，但仍需要一个催化剂来促使曲线趋平——问题在于该群体的资金流向更倾向于配置股市。

On top of this, is ongoing pressure on the INR (a notable monthly underperformer) from tariffs and an potential shift in regional alignment on the political side. Equity FPI outflows amounted to \(\) 3.2b\(in August, over\) \ \(14b\) YTD. Higher tariffs, no real attempt by Modi to change behaviour re Russian oil and a market that has tried to sell USDINR a handful of times already this year leaves the market less willing to step in despite the NDF approaching 88.50. RBI sold a fair amount at 88.00 in the NDF during August (our estimate was\) \ \(10b\) ) and are likely to have been active as we' ve broken higher. We' ve been here before with this dynamic where come maturity of the NDF contracts between the market and the RBI, the market community has to replace the seller of USD (RBI) with someone else – assuming the RBI don' t roll. This creates natural short- dated NDF points (and o/r) demand unless a private USD seller steps in – this keeps NDF/NDS yields elevated versus OIS equivalents in the short- end. This has implications for the demand for XCCY receive positions (3yr sat at +68bp) and related products (SSA paper) which sit near a 150bp pick up to comparable IGBs on a post tax- basis.
Chart: INR Short end Rates

3. Politics in Asia rarely cause sustained market volatility – a function of various factors – one of which is the relatively small part offshore capital play in equity markets within the region. Nevertheless – protests in Indonesia over the past few days and the latest in the Thailand leadership saga weigh on local assets – albeit in very different form. In the latter, its unambiguously negative for Thai growth prospects – though they weren’t great to begin with so the ‘delta’ to the new ‘news’ should be fairly limited. Indonesia will suffer from a positional adjustment flow in the near term but rarely do these events sustain as a material market event – unless as always – there are permanent shifts in personnel onshore.

3. 亚洲的政治局势很少引发持续的市场波动——这由多种因素造成，其中之一是离岸资本在该地区股市中所占比例相对较小。尽管如此，过去几天印尼的抗议活动以及泰国领导层风波的最新进展，仍对当地资产造成了影响——尽管形式截然不同。对于后者而言，这对泰国的增长前景无疑是负面的——不过其增长前景本就不佳，因此新消息带来的“变化”应当相对有限。印尼在短期内将因仓位调整资金流而承压，但此类事件很少会持续成为重大市场事件——除非一如既往地，国内人员出现永久性变动。

4. How much is left for Asian monetary policy easing cycles? The below chart frames this next question nicely ... There is a strong argument here that the bulk of whatever easing we can expect from CBs to be finished by the end of 2025, if not by Q126. Will whatever is delivered be enough to create positive growth impulses into 2026 or will fiscal have to bear the load? I have long been a believer in the framework that Asian curves rarely steepen in cutting cycles – there is little evidence that cycles go deep enough or correlate with fiscal easing to justify pricing higher forward rates. Inflation is almost never an Asian problem and growth drags tend to be multifold in terms of real rates being too high, and fiscal on the whole disappointing in its implementation. Indeed; last week we had the BSP cut to 5%, but signal the cycle was potentially nearing an end (for what its worth, we still expect them to cut to 4.5%). The BOK shifted forecasts higher for 2025 and 2026 but 1 more member tilted in favour of a rate cut within 3mo to bring the total to 5 out of 6 members of the MPC. The curve however sold off marginally and terminal pricing remains pinned at 2.25% - ie, just 1 more cut that the market fully expects and thus prices to be delivered in the October MPC.
Chart: Asian IRS - Whats Priced?
How Much is Priced into Asian IRS Curves (bp)
Source:GS/BBG来源：GS/BBG

Increasingly, I expect fiscal stances for 2026 to be come a topic of conversation / discussion as monetary space becomes more limited. Two thematic pieces in the past 3- 4mos from GIR on the matter...
EM in Focus: The IMF's Fiscal Monitor Update — More Restraint, Given Constraints. (4May25) The EM Trader: Fiscal in Focus. (4Jun25)

5. Do we still favour RPGB/INDOGB longs over IGBs? On a relative value basis – this trade performed well in August from both a rates and a fx + rates perspective however both RPGB/INDOGB hit significant hurdles late last week. Directionally – much of the reason for ownership of RPGB/INDOGB vs IGB remain true. This note from 10 days ago still holds mostly true. https://marquee.gs.com/content/markets/en/2025/08/21/a7dfb9cb-67a5-415c-91d0-c6f0e0f573a9.html.
Chart: IGB vs INDOGB vs UST YTD Returns
10y Bond Performance Local CCY Returns
10y Bond Performance USD Total Return

Are Indonesian GBs still a buy? Short answer is yes. Liquidity is still very flush - the onshore market has seen SRBI paper mature over the course of 2025 (something we flagged very early), and liquidity come into the interbank with INDonia trading significantly lower within the corridor- but the fast money community' s supply (T/P) and the fortnightly supply calendar make it a buyer' s market this week if one is patient... should political noise remain present... the past week' s episode reminds one to not be greedy when the FX hedge got as cheap as it did and the volatility of return streams from a USD based investor boils down to the FX. Hedge the FX if you must - but the underlying volatility of the local bond return stream favours remaining engaged in the trade (blue line on the 1st chart above).

印尼国债仍然值得买入吗？简短的回答是：是的。市场流动性依然非常充裕——在岸市场的 SRBI 票据将在 2025 年陆续到期（这是我们很早就提示过的），流动性也流入了银行间市场，INDonia 在区间内的交易价格显著走低——但快钱资金的供应（T/P）以及每两周一次的供给节奏，使得本周如果有耐心的话，这是一个买方市场......前提是政治噪音依然存在......上周的情况提醒我们，当外汇对冲成本降到如此低的水平时，不要过于贪婪，因为对于以美元为基础的投资者来说，回报波动的核心在于外汇。如果必须，可以对冲外汇风险——但本地债券回报流的内在波动性依然支持继续参与这笔交易（见上方 1 图表中的蓝线）。

There are numerous questions with regards to ownership metrics - and whilst its true that in IDR terms, foreign ownership has increased by 76trn IDR YTD, it is by no means stretched given the increasing size of the market. Indeed - as per the below chart; on a rolling 5 day

cumulative basis - changes in net foreign ownership haven' t been more than \(0.2\%\) of the total market outstanding amount - in sharp contrast to pre- 2020. Lots explain this shift - but the fact remains - the market structure is very different. The prevalence of BI to act as volatility suppressors too is most evident with them supporting the market already into what amounted to be a 10bp sell off.
Chart: INDOGB Foreign Ownership
Source:GS/BBG来源：GS/BBG
Thursday outlining the latest thoughts on both.
6. 美元区的港币和新加坡元市场在各自的流动性驱动下呈现出独特的资金流动动态。这些市场在深入理解其背后两套体系的情况下，能够提供显著的盈利机会。我在周四撰写了一篇长文（见此）详细阐述了对这两个市场的最新看法。

In a nutshell, the disparity between the SGD NEER and the level of local SG rates (o/r and versus the basket) is not necessarily an opportunity to be short the NEER; and rates can continue to rally amidst a pretty clear signal (by inaction) that the MAS support significantly easier policy via liquidity/rates. Deposit rates continue to fall; as does overnight repo financing - adding to our preference to own

In HKD, the swing of market forces pushed both cash and term funding much tighter with T/N positive and for a brief moment in time HKD O/N Rates were higher than that of the USD SOFR equivalent. That has normalized quickly and the underlying flow dynamic remain as per the note linked above with the systematic community the main market flow and price taker of liquidity at the moment. Real economy flows have returned too and widening in HKD XCCY (HI/SO) in the belly provides an opportunity to pay forwards in this market. The chart below shows the current 2y2y HKD HISO level relative to the spot 2yr.
You know where to come if you want to trade.
Chart: 2y2y vs 2y HKD XCCY
https://marquee.gs.com/s/marketview/dashboards/view-from-the-captains-bar

Political and Economic Risks Emerging market countries are by definition "in transformation" and they are therefore more exposed to the risk of swift political change and economic downturns than their industrialised counterparts. Indeed, in recent years, many emerging market countries have undergone significant political, economic and social change. In many cases, far- reaching political changes have resulted in constitutional and social tensions and in some cases instability and reaction against market reforms has occurred. With respect to any emerging or developing nation, there is the possibility of nationalisation, expropriation or confiscation, political changes, government regulation, uncertainties as to the status, interpretation and application of laws, possible lower levels of disclosure and regulation, social instability or other developments (including war) which could affect adversely the economies of such nations or the foreign exchange rates. There can be no assurance that in the future such factors and in particular political changes will not adversely affect the economic conditions of an emerging market country. Political or economic instability may affect investor confidence, which could in turn have a negative impact on the creditworthiness of the Asset Issuer, the value of the Assets and on foreign exchange markets.

个基点以来，印度央行（RBI）一直是利率接收交易的主要障碍，其通过流动性管理，使利率交易维持在50个基点宽走廊的中间位置，并围绕5.50%的政策利率波动（如下图所示）。未来12个月内加息的可能性不超过5%，而且RBI拥有足够的工具来缓解因外汇疲软引发的流动性紧缩，因此市场在固定利率高于5.52-5.54%时，仍在OIS曲线12个月以内的部分找到接收交易的分布价值，理由是其具有类似期权的结构。更高的

50个基点宽走廊的中间位置，并围绕5.50%的政策利率波动（如下图所示）。未来12个月内加息的可能性不超过5%，而且RBI拥有足够的工具来缓解因外汇疲软引发的流动性紧缩，因此市场在固定利率高于5.52-5.54%时，仍在OIS曲线12个月以内的部分找到接收交易的分布价值，理由是其具有类似期权的结构。更高的关税征收、RBI减少货币市场操作（此前支撑了10年期利率点位）、第二季度优于预期的经济增长，以

I的拐点上行来收敛，这些因素共同推动了收益率曲线形态明显变陡。债券一直是薄弱环节，5x10年期IGB的陡峭度已从+20个基点上升至+32个基点，10x30年期IGB约为+70个基点，尽管整体收益率高于7.30%，且我们认为本地保险公司在这一水平上会发现价值，但仍需要一个催化剂来促使曲线趋平——问题在于该群体的资金流向更倾向于配置股市。 On top of this, is ongoing pres
